videoSnippet.title: Star of The Show | Carlsen vs Gelfand | Candidates Tournament 2013. | Round 10
videoSnippet.description:
#agadmator Check out agadmator's chess Channel Song here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ApkShmA65qg&t=3s

Magnus Carlsen kept his half point lead in round 10 of the FIDE Candidates’ Tournament in London. On Monday the Norwegian ground down Boris Gelfand (Israel) with White in a Rossolimo Sicilian. His main rivals also won: Vladimir Kramnik (Russia) admitted that he was lucky as in a drawish Berlin Endgame Alexander Grischuk (Russia) blundered in time trouble, while the opponent of Levon Aronian (Armenia), Vassily Ivanchuk (Ukraine), overstepped the time limit for the fourth time in this tournament, after playing well in a Budapest Gambit. Dejected about his score with White so far, Teimour Radjabov (Azerbaijan) went for a quick draw against Peter Svidler (Russia) in a Grünfeld. 

Read more here: http://london2013.fide.com/en/component/content/article/1-news-en/209--aronian-carlsen-a-kramnik-winners-in-10th-round-fide-candidates

Check out all photos from Round 10 of the 2013 candidates tournament here http://london2013.fide.com/images/stories/gallery/Round%2010%20London/index.html#

Magnus Carlsen vs Boris Gelfand
"Magnus P.I." 
World Championship Candidates (2013), London ENG, rd 10, Mar-27 
Sicilian Defense: Nezhmetdinov-Rossolimo Attack (B30)

1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 e6 4. O-O Nge7 5. Re1 a6 6. Bf1 d5 7. ed5 Nd5 8. d4 Nf6 9. Be3 cd4 10. Nd4 Bd7 11. c4 Nd4 12. Bd4 Bc6 13. Nc3 Be7 14. a3 a5 15. Qd3 O-O 16. Rad1 Qc7 17. Be5 Qb6 18. Qg3 Rfd8 19. Rd8 Qd8 20. Rd1 Qb6 21. Bd4 Qb3 22. Rd3 Qc2 23. b4 ab4 24. ab4 Nh5 25. Qe5 Bf6 26. Qh5 Bd4 27. Rd4 Qc3 28. Qa5 Rf8 29. Qb6 e5 30. Rd1 g6 31. b5 Be4 32. Qf6 h5 33. h4 Bf5 34. Rd5 Qc1 35. Qe5 Be6 36. Rd4 Ra8 37. Qe2 Kh7 38. Rd1 Qc3 39. Qe4 Ra1 40. Ra1 Qa1 41. c5 Qc3 42. Qb7 Qe1 43. b6 Bc4 44. Qf3 Qf1 45. Kh2 Qb1 46. b7 Qb5 47. c6 Bd5 48. Qg3
